text:
Hello, is there a way to eliminate ability to paste URLs into HubSpot forms text fields? I have first name and the last name field and I do not want it to be able to receive URLs, just text.
I know that I could do validation from a frontend but it is easy to change by a potential hacker, is it possible for a HubSpot to not receive it but throw an error?

:orange_heart:*Please take a moment to review our Code of Conduct*:orange_heart:

We want the HubSpot Developer community to be inclusive and welcoming. By following our Code of Conduct, you can help ensure that's the case.

TL;DR:
• Be respectful
• Be inclusive (try not to say, "Hey guys, hey boys, hey [any specific group]")
• No self promotion, except for <#C0121KGC6RM|showcase> and <#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> 
• No unsolicited DMs
Read the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/slack/code-of-conduct|whole thing here> - and thanks for being a part of the HubSpot Developer Community!

Want to report a violation? DM <@UQNEXHW14> or fill out the <https://form.asana.com/?k=p7aM0fpd3G4JGETDL_nYXg&d=8587152060687|anonymous form here>.

Thank you so much! This is so helpful. Your instructions for how to test before deploying are great. I am fairly new to HubSpot so I was not entirely sure of the best way to do this. I'm going to give it a try!
Hi <@U042QF4T36G>, can you please post this in Ideas?
Any way you can use the Sandbox portal as a staging environment for content, and when satisfied, push this to the live portal? Or would we need to use the API to sync pages

has anyone been able to work with the new data requests in the privacy center, to automate incoming data deletion or data download requests via workflow, such as a using a custom action to trigger a flow in Salesforce? or similar? I can’t find any api or documentation on the data requests module or privacy center anywhere.

Does anybody have any ideas on how to install a non-HubSpot form but get around sensitive fields and only really pass through the email address? I have a non-HubSpot form that currently has some issues retrieving submissions, I suspect partially due to some of the fields possibly being considered "sensitive" by HubSpot? That said, I don't actually really need the data on the form, I primarily just need the email address to pass through as a way for HubSpot to create the contact record and/or more importantly pass on the attribution data.

Hello Everyone
I have created a website and want to make it live. Do we only need to add the live domain in HubSpot, or are there other steps involved to go live? Please help me.
